rounds.response:
Your hand: 3♠ 3♥  
Board: 10♦ 9♣ 3♦ 8♥  

You have a set of 3’s (three of a kind) — currently the best possible hand, but several cards can hurt you:

• 7♣ or 7♠ gives anyone with J-Q a made 10-high straight (7-8-9-10-J).  
• Any 6 or J also completes 10-high straights.  
• A fourth diamond (on the river) turns your set into a flush-loser if villain has one.  

Stacks:  
• You have 900 chips left. Pot is 280. Villain bet 80 (pot is now 360) and sits with 820 behind.

Plainly calling lets them catch up cheaply. A medium-sized raise builds the pot now before scare cards arrive, while still leaving you roll-off room if they shove.

Action: [Raise 200]
